name: 林益辰
objective:
本課程旨在提升管理決策之心智、理論與技能，並在複雜企業環境下的實務管理決策案例分析應用，使了解在國際環境中科技進展及應用下，如何透過各種決策模式了解並分析複雜情境，達成經濟及有效的管理決策。另一方面，透過了解、認同領導統御的理念、特質及行為，建立學生全面性的傑出領導素養。
This course covers theoretical knowledge and practical skills providing the ability to develop managerial decisions based on the application of various methods in the international environment, including: studying and analyzing the process of making economic and managerial decisions. In the same time, this course is designed to provide a basic introduction to leadership by focusing on what it means to be a good leader. Emphasis in the course is on the practice of potential philosophy of leadership, traits, skills, behaviors, and develop students a great overall leadership proficiency.
schedule:
Week1-2: How perception influences our understanding of DM/leadership
Week3-4: Changing paradigms of leadership history/thoughts
Week5-6: The “Decision Architect”, responsive and decisive leadership
Week7-8: Personality, leadership style and decision-making activity
Midterm
Week10-11: A systematic, mechanistic and structured approach to DM
Week12-13: Emotional Intelligence, collaborative practice and decision making
Week14-15: Critical Thinking Definitions,Barriers and Models 
Week16-17: Recognizing and Overcoming Bias in DM/leadership
Week18: Final
scorePolicy:
Oral/team report: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 25%
Class participation/involvement: 25%
materials:
1. Bazerman, M.H. and Moore, D.A. (2013), Judgment in Managerial Decision Making, 8th ed. New York: Wiley.
2. Kahneman, D., Sibony, O., & Sunstein, C. R. (2021). Noise: A flaw in human judgment. Little, Brown Spark.
3. Bazerman, Max. (2014). The power of noticing: What the best leaders see. New York: Simon & Schuster.
4. The required readings that I posted on NTUT Teams
